dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the brilliant colors of a middle eastern rug, th center of what seems to be a makeshift "meditation" space We slowly tilt up to discover the back of Riggan Thomson He is in the proper `Lotus' position, dressed only in tig white briefs and he appears to be meditating deeply. And this seems a little odd, it becomes all the more so when notice that he is levitating almost two feet above the fl His breath is calm and measured... in and out... in and o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did we end up here? (Beat.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is a fucking dump. We begin to slowly move toward Riggan's back while his me breathing continues. We see a clock on the wall, ticking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like balls. A slight twitch in Riggan's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't belong in this shithole. A Skype call shatters the silence. Close on his back, we Riggan as he walks over to the computer and answers the c On the computer screen appears Sam (21), in a pair of Lev and a Led Zeppelin T-shirt. She has simple and striking g looks, with an edge in her voice and behind her eyes. She stands in a Korean Deli among the flowers, talking to Rig through her iPhone.

dialogues.speaker: 1A
dialogues.text: The Korean Store owner (50) stands in the background scre at her the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, I can't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? What kind of-- (Turning to Korean.)

dialogues.speaker: SHUT UP
dialogues.text: (Back to screen.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of flowers did you say you wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alchemillas. Or something soothing that smells nice. Listen I can't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It all smells like fucking Kimchi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then whatever looks nice. Anything but roses. No roses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flowers don't need you touch! They need you buy!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Close into the screen.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this job. And the Skype call is over. Riggan closes the laptop and forward trying to regain his calm. His reflection appears the mirror, and for the first time we see his face. He ha dark goatee and his hair looks strangely abundant. There piece of paper on the mirror with the handwritten phrase thing is a thing, not what it is said of that thing."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggan, they're starting scene five. We need you on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... Riggan throws on a sweater and stumbles into his slacks. hurries out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...through the narrow corridors of the theater. There is of activity as various workers and stage hands appear and disappear carrying equipment and scenery. As Riggan desce stairs, a Stage HandВ· passes by in the opposite directio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Thomson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Already passed.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Riggan continues on until he arrives backstage. He runs i Jake (42) his producer and friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. It'd be even better if I could get Ralph to stop acting like he's in an educational video for syphilis... The camera moves off of them and onto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the stage. Suddenly we are in the midst of an American kitchen. Around the kitchen table sit Lesley (35), plain and no no her simple hairstyle and makeup can't hide how attractive is. Laura (35), dark, exotic, the kind of woman who makes person she meets feel like she's seducing them. And Ralph slightly handsome, slightly balding, slightly invisible. A half empty bottle of gin on the table, they drink from highball glasses as they chat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He loved her so much he tried to kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to kill you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (A beat.) Okay, well, he did beat me up one night. He dragged me around the living room by my ankles, yelling "I love you, I love

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LESLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you, bitch." What do you do with a love like that? RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that-- That is not love and you know it. Why do you insist on calling it-- LESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can say what you want, but I know what it was. RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, Nick? Does that sound like love to you? Riggan arrives at the table and sits. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. (Beat. In character.) I'm the wrong person to ask. I didn't know the man. I've only heard his name mentioned in passing. You'd have to know the particulars. But I think what you're saying is that love is absolute. RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The kind of love I'm talking about is... The kind of love I'm talking about, you don't try and kill people. LESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sadly.) It was love, Mel. To Eddie, it was. I don't care what anybody says. He was ready to die for it. RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask her what he did after she left him. LESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shot himself in the mouth. But he screwed that up, too. Poor Ed. RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Ed, my ass. The guy was dangerous. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he screw it up if he shot himself in the mouth? RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (By the numbers.) He used to carry this twenty-two. We lived like fugitives those days. I never knew--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Breaking character to direct. Exasperated.) Okay. Fugitives are on the run, Ralph. How many times do I have to-- Fugitives are scared. Give me more of that. Ralph nods. He takes a breath and dives in once again... RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (The same but louder.) We lived like fugitives those days... Extremely frustrated, Riggan stares out into the auditori From his POV we see Jake who is now sitting in the third His head buried in his hands, tortured by Ralph's perform Riggan turns back to Ralph. RALPH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I never knew if he was going to come out of the bushes or from behind a car and just start shooting. Riggan watches Ralph act and sees his whole production he down the drain. Ralph is just that bad. RALPH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man was crazy. He was capable of anything. The actors all wait for a cue from Riggan, who is now sta up into the lights above the stage. Laura finally picks u Riggan's cue. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ. What a nightmare... RALPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used to call me at the hospital and say... (Over the top.) "Son of a bitch. Your days are numbered." Silence. Ralph looks over to Riggan. RALPH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much? Little bit? I just wanted to give you a range, so you could-- And with that a light comes barreling down from it's perc crashes into Ralph's head, making him hit the floor like doll. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lesley and Annie (35), the Stage Manager, run over to Ral who is out cold. Not knowing what to do, they stare at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he breathing? Jake runs toward the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone call 911! Riggan slowly backs away from the chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that blood coming out of his ear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Riggan.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, he's breathing. What did he have for lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anyone call for help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Clapping.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up! Wake up! Two crew members try to help Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab his legs. I got the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move him! Wait for the ambulance. (Calling out.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the love of God! I could get a black audience in this theater faster than a doctor! Riggan heads off the stage, and Jake chases after him. We follow them as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they walk through the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? We'll have the understudy ready to rehearse in five--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the understudy. We have to postpone the preview. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you-- It's a full house. We would have to refund all the-- RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then do it. A crew memberВ· passes in the opposite direction. CREW MEMBERВ·

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Ralph? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be fine. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Wait. Fuck. Wait. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. It was going to be a disaster. That guy's the worst actor I've ever seen. The blood coming out of his ear was the most honest thing he's done so far. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not that bad. Riggan stops in his tracks and stares at Jake. JAKE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, he's fucking horrible. But-- Riggan starts walking again. JAKE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the press in your dressing room in a few hours. How are we-- RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make something up. Two TechniciansВ· hurry up in the opposite direction. RIGGAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake. This happened for a reason. It wasn't an accident. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-- (A beat.) I made it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. (Beat.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find me an actor. A good actor. Philip Seymour Hoffman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing the third Hunger Games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Fassbender?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing the prequel to the X-Men prequel. They arrive at Riggan's dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name? Jeremy Renner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The... the Hurt Locker guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's an Avenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With disgust.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. They put him in a cape, too? (A beat.) Look, I don't care. Find me someone. Riggan enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...his dressing room and tries to shut the door. Jake, st the corridor, stops it with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sticking his head in.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph'll sue us. He'll sue us. And he's got a case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggan releases the door. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then make him go away. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you suggest I do that? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my   lawyer, my producer and my oldest   friend. We are going to make this   work. Now just get out there and   do what you were born to do. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea. But I have faith. Now go away from me. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think we should-- Riggan slams the door shut on Jake. A beat. On a televisi segment of E! News. A busty blond, with an exaggerated sm hosts. BLOND WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and when we come back, an exclusive interview with Robert Downey Jr., who tells us about the billion-dollar Iron Man franchise. The talented actor invited us onto the set of Iron Man 3... Riggan slams the tv off, his mind racing. He sits on a ch MAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That clown doesn't have half your talent and he's making a fortune in that Tin Man get up. Riggan stares into the mirror, in the reflection he catch sight of a poster from a movie called "Birdman 3". The superhero, Birdman (a younger Riggan in a bird costume), widely spread, stares directly back at him. A hand writte note on the top of the poster reads: "Thomson, break a wi From the boys at Local 1." Riggan tries to calm himself w mantra... RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Breathing in, I embrace my anger. Breathing out, I smile to it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRDMAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embrace it. Kiss it. Turn it around and fuck it in the-- A knock on the door behind him. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now! Laura opens the door and sticks her head in. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Two words. Shia La Beouf. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's three words. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's two. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. She closes the door. Riggan tries to calm himself down, b Laura opens the door again. LAURA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it we're not going to dinner anymore? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have an actor. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a life. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura... LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Whatever. (Goes to leave but stops.) You remember at Joan's when you asked me to come do a Broadway play with you? You said it would be fun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far? No fun. Riggan closes the door and looks at the Birdman poster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fun? You know what would be fun? Getting the fuck out of here before we humiliate ourselves. That would be fun. Riggan looks at himself in the mirror and begins to pull his hair. As it comes off his head, we discover it was a He turns away from the mirror, trying desperately to stay calm. Something catches his eye: a vase of roses on the e of the table. A card in them says, "They didn't have the whatever you wanted - Sam". Enraged, Riggan focuses on th vase. It begins to shift. Then, with a surge of anger, without ever touching it, he sends it crashing against th wall on the other side of the room. The camera pans over the roses scattered across the floor hovers over the carpet and around the perimeter of the ro until it finally settles on Riggan, now dressed in a casu blazer.

dialogues.speaker: A5
dialogues.text: It is later the same day. He is sitting on the sofa and o chairs in front of him are three journalists: Gabriel, a geeky theatre journalist, wearing thick glasse a thin tie. Clara, a reporter from an entertainment blog. Han, a polite, obese Japanese journalist, who sits next t translator, another Japanese guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does somebody go from playing the lead in a comic book franchise to adapting Raymond Carver for the stage? Riggan tries to remain calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, as you're probably aware, Barthes said, "The cultural work done in the past by gods and epic sagas is now done by laundry detergent commercials and comic strip characters." It's a big leap you've taken... Riggan shifts nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Absolutely. As you said... that Barthes said... Birdman, like Icarus... CLARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on. Who's this Barthes guy? Which Birdman was he in? GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roland Barthes was a French philosopher, who-- CLARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Sure. Now, is it true you've been injecting yourself with semen from baby pigs? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CLARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a method of facial rejuvenation. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you that? CLARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was tweeted by... (checks her notes) @prostatewhispers. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lie. CLARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But did you do it? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid at all that people will say you're doing this play to battle the impression that you're a washed-up super hero? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not. And that's exactly why 20 years ago I refused to do Birdman 4. HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birdman 4??? You do Birdman 4??? Jake opens the door and the camera pans to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. That's enough for today. Thank you for coming. We're expecting some great pieces from you... Riggan stares at the Birdman poster. JAKE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Publicity guys are trying to get you a Times feature. Riggan stands up and pulls the Birdman poster off of the wall. JAKE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, How'd it-- Whoa. If I were you I wouldn't do that. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to look at it anymore. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a present from the crew. Don't fuck with those guys, they're union. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. Riggan leaves the poster on the floor, facing the wall, a walks to the window. He opens it. We can hear distant dru coming from the street. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... How'd it go? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Worried.) Did they ask about Ralph? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. He did it, you know? The motherfucker threatened to sue us. Didn't even wait to get out of the hospital. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, what did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I say? I said, "You motherfucker. You're threatening me? ME? I swear to god, you fuck, I so much as get a letter from a lawyer, the press'll get the pictures we got off your computer."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy has a thing for nuns... in diapers. What do you care? You shouldn't have any knowledge about it anyway. The important thing is that I made him go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's fantastic. One problem. We don't have an actor. And if we cancel the first preview the press will smell the blood. We can't afford to lose any more money. At all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pay an understudy, let's use the understudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Riggan, listen to me. Our dream actor is not going to knock on that door and say: "Hey fellas, when do we start?"

dialogues.speaker: B5
dialogues.text: There is a knock at the door. Leslie peeks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE
dialogues.text: Did you find another actor?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Well... Mike's available.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGAN
dialogues.text: He is?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Mike who?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGAN
dialogues.text: I thought he was doing--

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE
dialogues.text: He was. He quit. Or got fired.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Mike who?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGAN
dialogues.text: Which one? Quit or fired?

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE
dialogues.text: With Mike it's usually both.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Mike Fucking Who?

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE
dialogues.text: Shiner.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: RIGGAN
dialogues.text: Jake...

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Yes! How do you know Mike Shiner?

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE
dialogues.text: We share a vagina.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGAN
dialogues.text: You think he'd want to do it?

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know? LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he said he'd want to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake. Hang on a minute. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Riggan) Ask me if he sells tickets. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he sell tickets? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shitload of tickets. Now ask me if the critics like him? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they like him? JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want to spooge on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Indicating Lesley.) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leslie... LESLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on his face. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything for a reason, right? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he'll be able to come tonight? LESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can call him and find out. Riggan gives Jake a look. JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call his agent. Jake charges out of the room. The camera follows him into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the hallway and as Jake makes a left turn, Annie enter the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, turn the work lights on and get me a fresh copy of the script. We're gonna have a "put in" tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll find out... Jake disappears down the hall and we follow Annie through theater and onto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the stage, where she turns some of the stage work ligh We pan along the stage until we find Riggan, wearing the clothes as before, scanning the empty auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intimidating. Isn't it? Riggan sees Mike Shiner (39) coming down the aisle, slove dressed with mussed hair and intense eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea who walked these boards before you? (Beat.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geraldine Page, Marlon Brando, Helen Hayes, Jason Robards... And now you. Riggan Thomson. Riggan, trying to hide the intimidation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming on such short notice, Mike. I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. This is what we do. (Indicates a script.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you wrote this adaptation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're directing the adaptation and starring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambitious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. A sly smile from Mike. He leaps onto the stage. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we do a bit of it? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I wasn't expecting you to-- MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First preview is tomorrow, right? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you can go on with the script until you feel comfortable-- MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just do some of it. Riggan tries to hide his excitement. He grabs the script nearby table and walks it over to Mike. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look at page twenty-- MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I don't need that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need the script. Just give me a cue. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feed me a line. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't-- What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I really do get it. SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're caught up in all this stuff, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff... SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. (Beat.) Riggan... You don't have to be a great father right now, you just have to be one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Suddenly, Laura opens the door and sticks her head in. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Noticing Sylvia.) Oh, sorry. She closes the door. Awkward silence. SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how is that going? Is she and Sam--? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to a small fridge, takes out a beer and closes it SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're drinking? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a beer. SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... He sits and sips in silence for a moment. Then he begins take out the wig. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's going on with you? SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Nothing. Everything's the same I guess. I'm going back to teaching. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking about refinancing the Malibu house. SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh-- I'm sorry? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking about-- SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I heard you. I just need a second to-- (A beat.) That's gonna be Sam's house. Why would you-- (A beat.) What? For this play? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Honest and vulnerable.) I need the money. SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea how crazy that sounds? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say? My health lasted longer than the money... Go figure that out. Riggan seems pensive and lost. SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggan... (Beat.) What's going on?... Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggan gently looks up to Sylvia. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a chance to do something right. And I have to take it. I have to. SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny. I was sitting here waiting for you, and all of a sudden I couldn't remember why we broke up. Silence. Then, as if he hasn't heard what she said. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last time I flew here from LA, George Clooney was sitting two seats in front of me. With those cuff links, and that... chin. We ended up flying through this really bad storm. The plane started to rattle and shake, and everyone on board was crying... and praying. And I just sat there-- Sat there thinking that when Sam opened that paper it was going to be Clooney's face on the front page. Not mine. (A beat.) Did you know that Farrah Fawcett died on the same day as Michael Jackson? She smiles sadly. She kisses him on the head and goes to door. RIGGAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did we break up? SYLVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Looks him in the eye.) You threw a kitchen knife at me... Riggan is smacked by that memory. His eyes on the floor. SYLVIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and one hour later you were telling me how much you loved me. (Beat.) Just because I didn't like that ridiculous comedy you did with Goldie Hawn didn't mean I did not love you. But that's what you always do. You confuse love with admiration. She smiles sadly. He looks at her. As Sylvia opens the do she turns back to Riggan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your house, so do what you want with it. Just make sure you're there for our daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not Farrah Fawcett, Riggan. She exits. Painful silence... until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have done that reality show they offered us. "The Thomsons." That would've been good. Crazy, druggy, wise ass daughter. Milfy wife with the perky tits. People would have watched that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the poster.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Riggan stands up and grabs his jacket. He opens the door goes out to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Almost whispering.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. Riggan walks between crew members. Annie interrupts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun bed is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means there's a sun bed out there being delivered to in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who ordered a sun bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike. He says it's for his character. Carver's red necks, "people of the land". Part of his process and that shit. Riggan cannot deal with this right now. He continues walk until he arrives at a metal door that takes him out to...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. AN ALLEY WAY
dialogues.text: ...an alley way. Riggan walks toward the street. There is playing drums. Riggan finds Mike leaning against a parked dazed and looking up at the marquis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Walk. Riggan begins to walk, Mike follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get you some coffee. Have I done anything to disrespect you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a lot riding on this play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People know who I am, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. People don't know you. They know the guy in the bird suit. They know the guy who tells those quaint, slightly vomitous stories on Letterman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sorry for being popular, but that--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With irony.) Popular? POPULAR?... Oh God, popularity is just the slutty little cousin of prestige. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I don't even know what that-- MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My reputation is riding on this play. And that's... That is... RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot. Exactly. Fuck you. Yes. This doesn't work out for you, you get to go home to your studio pals and jump right back into that cultural genocide you guys are perpetrating. "There's a douchbag born every minute". That was P.T. Barnum's premise when he got rich inventing the circus. And you and your pals know nothing's changed, and whatever toxic shit you make people are still gonna pay to see it. But, after you're gone, I'll still be here. I'll still be making my living on the stage. Baring my soul. Wrestling with emotions, complex emotions. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Is that what tonight was about then? (Mocking him.) Wrestling with "complex emotions"? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight was about making it alive. About making it bleed. This isn't the Warner Brothers lot, Riggan. This is the city, and this is how we do things. Mike turns and opens the front door of The Rum House. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have coffee in here. He walks into the restaurant. Riggan backtracks and we fo him into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The Rum House. Mike stands at the bar, the bartender already pouring two whiskeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To bartender.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Tommy. Tommy nods and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Getting back on point.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People were laughing in our faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Handing Riggan a drink.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight they were laughing, tomorrow they'll be... be.. tweeting about us. Fuck `em. Who cares??? These are the people who pay half price to watch us rehearse. Stop fucking caring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing Raymond Carver. This play is a drama. This play is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what this play is. These are previews. This is where we find out what the play is. Mike points to an Older Woman sitting at the bar. She sip martini and scribbles in a notebook with a sour expressio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that woman over there? The one that looks like she just licked a homeless guy's ass? Nothing matters until she writes five hundred words about us in the New York Times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tabitha Dickinson. Yes. And, believe it or not, the only thing that matters in theater is whether she likes us or not. She does, we run. She doesn't, we're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Preoccupied.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does look like she licked a homeless guy's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor, don't get your panties in a twist over a preview, alright? And don't tell me how to do my job. Cause, this is my town. And, to be honest, nobody gives a shit about you around here. LADY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Riggan Thompson, right? Two fat tourists in "Mamma Mia" t-shirts, with a seven ye kid, approach the table. HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Timidly.) We're sorry to interrupt... LADY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind terribly if we got a picture? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. It's no trouble at all. The Lady shoves her camera into Mike's hands. LADY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Mike.) Would you mind? Mike gets up with a blank expression and takes the camera The Lady pushes the kid into the booth next to Riggan. LADY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Ordering Mike.) The button right on top there. KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this guy? LADY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To his son.) Come on, Billy. He used to be like Batman. She yanks the kid closer and they squeeze up against Rigg Mike takes the photo and holds the camera to the lady. LADY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Mike) I think you screwed that one up. Take another one. Mike takes another picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LADY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Riggan.) God bless you, darlin'. You're very sweet. And handsome! She kisses Riggan hard on the mouth. Then gets up, giddy, takes her son by the hand. As the couple leaves, husband a five dollar bill into Mike's hands. HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really appreciate it. An agitated Mike takes a sip of whiskey. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we good here? Cause I'm gonna go. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow. Mike places the dollar under one of the shot glasses and to walk away, but then stops and turns curiously. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why Raymond Carver? You never told me. Riggan looks at Mike for a second, than reaches for his w and produces an old cocktail napkin with some writing on slides it to Mike. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time ago, I did a play back in high school in Michigan. He was in the audience. He sent this backstage after. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Thank you for an honest performance. Ray Carver." What is this? Riggan looks vulnerable. He is trying to make Mike unders the importance of the napkin, to build a bridge between t RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when I knew I was going to be an actor. Mike can't stop himself from smiling. RIGGAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that funny? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wrote it on a cocktail napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... Mike slides the napkin back to Riggan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was drunk.

dialogues.speaker: A17
dialogues.text: He walks away and we follow him as he passes by the bar n to Tabitha Dickinson, the Critic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You headed to Hollywood, Mike? Mike stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollywood's headed here, Tabby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A devilish smile.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck with that. Mike looks directly into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "A man becomes a critic when he can not be an artist, in the same way that a man becomes an informer when he cannot be a soldier." Flaubert, right? He flashes his own devilish smile. She stares back. If sh weren't so much older than him, you'd swear there was sex electricity between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a Hollywood clown in a Lycra bird suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And at 8 o'clock tomorrow, he's gonna get on stage and risk everything. What're you gonna be doing? A standoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever worry that I'll give you a bad review?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sure you will. If I ever give a bad performance. (Beat.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Dickinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Shiner. Mike smiles and waves over to an obviously nervous Riggan goes toward the exit, but we stay with Tabitha, scribblin her notebook. Suddenly she raises her eyes and, with a da expression, looks at Riggan who is passing by. We follow Riggan toward the exit. Through the window we s leave the restaurant. Then we pan to a wooden wall, and t wall takes us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the theater hallway. Riggan walks through the quiet co until he arrives at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the Green Room. Sam sits listlessly, drawing some line across a roll of toilet paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you still doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Continues scribbling.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I'm-- Nothing. Your costumes are hanging in your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the coconut water you wanted. If you want me to get--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure if I said thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of it. You've been doing a good job. And I've been... SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I just wanted to say that-- (He stops abruptly.) What is that? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That smell. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't-- RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you-- RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me. She does. He examines her eyes, then immediately rises, s the room. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad... RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Continuing to search.) You have to be shitting me... Where is it? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we not do this? Riggan pulls a jar of peanut butter from the trash. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is chunky peanut butter that happens, by the way, to have Omega--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggan pulls a stubbed joint out of the jar. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. That's pot. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, just relax. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax? What the hell are you doing? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protecting myself from cataracts? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this to me! SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUT UP! You know what I'm talking about. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You're talking about you. What else is new? RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to-- SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Make it about me? I wouldn't dream of it. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. I'm trying to do something that's important... SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not important. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important to me! Alright? Maybe not to you, or your cynical playmates whose sole ambition is to end up going viral and who, by the way, will only be remembered as the generation that finally stopped talking to one another. But to me... To me... This is-- God. This is my career, this is my chance (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to do some work that actually means something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means something to who? You had a career before the third comic book movie, before people began to forget who was inside the bird costume. You're doing a play based on a book that was written 60 years ago, for a thousand rich, old white people whose only real concern is gonna be where they go to have their cake and coffee when it's over. Nobody gives a shit but you. And let's face it, Dad, it's not for the sake of art. It's because you just want to feel relevant again. Well, there's a whole world out there where people fight to be relevant every day. And you act like it doesn't even exist! Things are happening in a place that you willfully ignore, a place that has already forgotten you. I mean who are you? You hate bloggers. You make fun of twitter. You don't even have a Facebook page. You're the one who doesn't exist. You're doing this because you're scared to death, like the rest of us, that you don't matter. And you know what? You're right. You don't. It's not important. You're not important. Get used to it. Silence. Riggan seems devastated, and Sam can see that. Sam (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad... She looks at him sympathetically, but not knowing what to say... exits. After a moment Riggan gets up and heads for the trash can digs out the roach, grabs some matches and lights it. Mus begins to sound. He inhales deeply and holds the smoke fo few seconds and finally exhales. He coughs, tosses away t joint and heads out of the kitchen. We follow him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as he slowly walks until he disappears into the darkne the corridor. We keep moving forward until we end up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...backstage. We are in the middle of the second preview. music continues, it belongs to the play. Laura is by herself on stage performing the end of a scen stands in the middle of a surrealistic forest set, at dus There is fog, and trees. A strong, artificial wind blows through Laura's hair. Desolate music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the audience as soliloquy.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the days before Nick's depression really started to eat away at him, he had no idea I was pregnant. And I never intended on telling him. I guess we make choices in life, and we choose to live with them. Or not. I didn't want that baby... Three dancers on stage pass by in front of Laura. We foll the dancers backstage where we find Mike and Lesley weari pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Not because I didn't love Nick. And not because I didn't love the-- The idea of it. But because I just wasn't ready to love myself. There's a certain distance to it all now. A wistful distance. Underscored by a gentle breeze and the sound of the birds... laughing at the whimsy of it all. A stage hand helps Mike and Lesley into a double bed. The camera slips under the covers with them and stays there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Les...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not. It's just that sometimes you don't consider other people's feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm hard. Feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you gotta be kidding. The stage begins to revolve as we hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...music through the transition. It remains dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's really do this. Let's fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? No. Mike rolls on top of Lesley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out... Mike continues to maneuver himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious, Mike. Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mel. Not Mike. Mel. A knock on a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri! Terri! A furious Lesley tries to reposition herself under Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri! I know you're in there! The knocking gets louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terri??? Mike, lost in his libido, has begun to have sex with Lesl The camera comes out from under the covers and pans to Ri who stumbles into what is now the Motel Room set. He wear mustache and a long wig, that makes him look like a wild He holds a gun in his right hand. A neon "Motel" sign is illuminated. A clever effect of falling rain is visible b the set, accompanied by the appropriate sound effect. Rig is wet because of the "rain". Lesley uses Riggan's entrance to escape from Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed! Mike hops out of bed, unaware of the very noticeable erec protruding underneath his pajama bottoms. Some laughter from the audience. LESLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Lesley doesn't understand the audience response, until sh notices the erection herself. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Lesley.) Why? I need you to tell me why. I lived for you. I worshipped you... MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Ed, I know this is hard but-- More laughter. Riggan is disturbed, but he continues... RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mike) Fuck you. Shut up. Fuck you. He shoves Mike violently to the floor. LESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie! Please! Riggan points the gun at Mike's head. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with me? Why do I end up having to beg people to love me? LESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed. Eddie. Please... Give me the gun. She begins to cry. Her performance is beautiful. LESLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look at me. I was drowning. I was not capable of-- You deserve to be loved. You do. RIGGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to be what you wanted. (Beat.) Now I spend every fucking minute praying to be someone else. Someone I'm not. Anyone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put down the gun, Ed. She just doesn't love you anymore. The audience is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A sad smile.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With sympathy.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you never will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A revelation.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't exist. I'm not even here. I don't exist. None of this matters. Riggan points the gun at Lesley. Then at Mike. Finally, h the gun to his own head and pulls the trigger. PUM! And w explosion, a fake blood mechanism splatters brains onto t stage. Riggan drops to the floor. A blackout. The audience applauds politely. The curtain f We follow Riggan off stage and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the wings, where Annie immediately helps him remove th bloody and wet wig with the propeller mechanism. Laura wa next to them for their bows. Meanwhile, a stage hand cros behind them, and we follow him as he goes on stage to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...reposition some scenery for the curtain call. The came carries us to the other side of the stage, where Mike and are in a heated exchange...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just, keep your voice down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Furious.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be shitting me. You can't get it up in six months...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LESLEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (She starts hitting him.) ...and now you try to fuck me in front of eight hundred strangers??? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me? I have to feel it. You know that. I told you that from the-- LESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck you... Music begins and the curtain rises. The audience applauds Lesley and Mike stride onto the stage and take their bows smiles plastered on their faces. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I was in the moment... LESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to stop. You fucking animal. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... You were incredible. LESLEY
